intro: Lochmocydia, commonly known as the white thorn, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems covered in sharp, thorny projections. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Lochmocydia is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
